result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Wielochowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anthony Wielochowski in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with John S. or his residence or place of employment

OCCR Tape#15-192/2:53
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.24  for a Pretrial Conference.

Defendant Anthony Wielochowski in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
